description: Duplicating binary multipliers, i.e. n+1 1-bits placed 2n bits from each other.
comments: A 2n-bit binary number can be reversed by multiplying it first by 2 and the n-th element of this sequence, masking it (bit and) with n-th element of A036214 and taking remainder of the division by ((2^((2*n)+2)) -1).
references: R. Schroeppel: DECsystem-10/20 Processor Reference Manual AA-H391A-TK, Chapter 2, User Operations, section 2.15: Programming Examples: Reversing Order of Digits.
links: Beeler, M., Gosper, R. W. and Schroeppel, R., A Bit-Reversing Example in HAKMEM (Item 167)
A. Karttunen, A Simple C-program Demonstrating Bit-Reversals
author: Antti Karttunen
